intro: Oenothera malacophylla, commonly known as the softleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, soft leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its oil-rich seeds. Oenothera malacophylla typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and pharmaceutical research.
